Specification for an ordered AUC value plus CI chart

get_explore_roc_spec.Rd

The chart consists of a set of points with confidence intervals representing the AUC and its confidence interval.

Usage

get_explore_roc_spec(ds, fig_size, sort_alph)

Arguments

ds

[data.frame()]

A data.frame

fig_size

[numeric(1)]

Size in pixels for the chart

sort_alph

[logical(1)]

Sort chart by parameter name

Value

A vegawidget specification

Details

Parameters, by default, are vertically ordered from highest to lowest AUC curve. When grouped, parameters will be combined with the grouping variable.

Internal checks

Shiny validation errors:

  • If the number of rows returned is greater than ROC_VAL$MAX_ROWS_EXPLORE a validation error is produced. Otherwise the chart is too large, for greater limits than ROC_VAL$MAX_ROWS_EXPLORE the session may crash.

Input dataframe list

ds

[data.frame()]

With columns:

  • predictor_parameter [factor()]: Predictor parameter name.

  • response_parameter [factor()]: Response parameter name.

  • group [factor()]: An optional column for the grouping value (if group is specified).

  • specificity [numeric()]: Sensitivity

  • sensitivity [numeric()]: Specificity

  • threshold [numeric()]: Threshold

  • auc [numeric(3)]: A numeric vector of length 3 c(LOWER AUC CI, AUC, UPPER AUC CI)
